title: 107_hr3
content: The "Economic Growth and Tax Relief Act of 2001" is the short title of the Act. It includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and specifies that changes in tax rates for individuals will not apply to section 15 of the Code. The "Economic Growth and Tax Relief Act of 2001" amends Section 1 by adding a new subsection regarding rate reductions after 2000. It introduces a new lowest rate bracket of 12 percent for taxable income not exceeding the initial bracket amount, with a 15 percent rate applying to income over that amount. The initial bracket amount is set at $12,000 for subsection (a). The "Economic Growth and Tax Relief Act of 2001" introduces new rate reductions for taxable income, with a lowest rate bracket of 12 percent for income not exceeding $12,000 in subsection (a). Adjustments are made for inflation in subsequent years. The "Economic Growth and Tax Relief Act of 2001" introduced rate reductions for taxable income, with the lowest rate bracket set at 12 percent for income below $12,000. Adjustments for inflation in subsequent years involve substituting '2005' for '1992' in certain cases. Rounding to the nearest multiple of $50 is required if the adjusted amount is not already a multiple of $50. The table will replace the tax rate for specific subsections. The tax rates for taxable years beginning in different calendar years are as follows: 12%, 28%, 31%, 36%, and 39.6% for 2002; 11%, 27%, 30%, 35%, and 38% for 2003; 11%, 26%, 28%, 34%, and 36% for 2004; 11%, 26%, 27%, 34%, and 35% for 2005; and 10%, 25%, 25%, 33%, and 33% for 2006 and thereafter. The Secretary will adjust tables under subsection (f) as needed. Section 24(d)(2) is amended, and section 32(h) is repealed. Conforming amendments are made to section 1(g)(7)(B) regarding tax percentages. Section 1(h) is amended to reduce the tax rate from 28 percent to 25 percent. Section 15 is amended to exclude rate reductions after 2000. Sections 531 and 541 are also amended to adjust tax calculations. Section 541 is amended to calculate taxable income based on the highest tax rate and undistributed personal holding company income. Section 3402 is amended to adjust tax percentages based on income brackets. Section 3402 is amended to adjust tax percentages based on income brackets, with the amendments applying to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2000. Amendments to withholding provisions made by subsection (c) apply to amounts paid after the 60th day following the enactment of this Act. The Act ensures that transfers to Social Security trust funds are unaffected by its enactment.
